thumb.name: Christmas Trees
thumb.verse: %3CB%3EEnvelopes%3C/B%3E are the first things a recipient sees when getting mail. So it%26#146;s worthwhile %26#150; and fun %26#150; to create, personalise and print envelopes to go with cards and letters.%3CBR%3E%3CBR%3E%3CB%3EDirections:%3C/B%3E%3CBR%3E%3CBR%3E1. Click on %3CB%3EPersonalise and Print Your Project%3C/B%3E to open the Create %26 Print workspace.%3CBR%3E2. Personalise the text. Select the text to write over it or change size, colour and font style.%3CBR%3E3. Click %3Cb%3EAdd Page%3C/b%3E for each additional envelope you want to create.%3CBR%3E4. Print your project.%3CBR%3E%3CBR%3E%3CB%3ETips:%3C/B%3E%3CBR%3E%3CBR%3EEnvelopes can be used for mailing stationery, brochures, flyers, notes, greeting cards and more.%3CBR%3E%3CBR%3EPrint your project on scrap paper first to check the alignment, spelling and overall look of the project.%3CBR%3E%3CBR%3E

thumb.name: Blue Ornaments
thumb.verse: %3CB%3EEnvelopes%3C/B%3E are the first things a recipient sees when getting mail.
